steps.title: They think your last text was funny.
steps.content: They think your last text was funny. “Lol” literally means “laughing out loud.” If you shared a story, meme, joke, or photo and you get “lol” as a response, the person you texted is telling you that they think you’re funny. Now, the person might not actually be laughing out loud, but “lol” “LOL,” “LOLed” and “loling” generally indicate amusement. [1] X Research source "Lol" can also be used just to acknowledge someone or something they said or to indicate a laid-back or chill vibe.

steps.title: They’re acknowledging an awkward moment.
steps.content: They’re acknowledging an awkward moment. Sometimes, “lol” is used to convey a mood rather than a specific phrase. If you just told someone about an embarrassing moment or mistake you made, they might use “lol” to show they empathize with what you’re going through. [2] X Research source

steps.title: They don’t have anything else to say.
steps.content: They don’t have anything else to say. “Lol” is a common response when you’re not sure what else to say. If the person doesn’t know how to respond to your last message, they might just type these 3 letters.

steps.title: They don’t want to continue the conversation.
steps.content: They don’t want to continue the conversation. Sometimes, “lol” signals a lack of interest. If the person you’re texting uses one-word responses and doesn’t ask questions or put a lot of effort into chatting with you, they might use “lol” as a way to signal that they’re done talking…at least for now. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Send an emoji.
steps.content: Send an emoji. If the person who sent you the message probably found your last message funny, an easy way to reply to this text is to send a happy or laughing emoji back. Try “😂” “🤣” or “😹”. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Reply with lol.
steps.content: Reply with lol. If you’re not sure what to say, just send “lol” back! Then, it’s up to them to figure out if and how to continue the conversation. You could also send “hehehe” or “hahaha.”

steps.title: Continue the conversation.
steps.content: Continue the conversation. Refer back to the message you sent before they replied with “lol” to keep chatting . Ask what they thought of your joke or story or see if they have any advice or input for you. [5] X Expert Source Joshua Pompey Relationship Expert Expert Interview. 27 November 2019. If you just told them about the ridiculous costume your mom bought for her dachshund and they replied with “lol,” say something like “You have got to see poor Pepper in this hot dog costume! It’s hilarious!”

steps.title: Respond with a GIF or meme.
steps.content: Respond with a GIF or meme. Choose one that's related to the conversation, or just pick one you think is funny. GIFs and memes are easy ways to bring a smile to your friend or crush's face and are great to use when you don't quite know what to say.

steps.title: Change the subject.
steps.content: Change the subject. If you want to keep chatting with your crush or friend but aren’t sure how to reply, just bring up a new topic. Asking a question is a great way to keep the convo going. [6] X Research source Say “So anyway, how was your day?” “Got any fun plans this weekend?” or “Your turn! What’s the best joke you’ve heard?”

steps.title: Let the conversation end.
steps.content: Let the conversation end. You don’t have to reply to their message, especially if the person isn’t putting much effort into chatting. Just go about your day and text them again later if you have something to share or want to strike up a new convo. [7] X Expert Source Joshua Pompey Relationship Expert Expert Interview. 27 November 2019. Don't worry if the conversational naturally dies out! You can always pique your crush's interest later with a new message. Give them a compliment or ask about something that's meaningful to them (from the lasted Drake single to the latest Dodgers game).
